meanings.definition: The act of establishing a homeport for a ship or fleet.
meanings.sent1: The homeporting of the naval fleet brought stability to their operations.
meanings.sent2: The homeporting of the cruise ship in Miami made it convenient for passengers.
meanings.sent3: The homeporting of the pirate ship in a small fishing village raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The homeporting of the submarines turned the harbor into a hidden fortress.
meanings.sent5: The homeporting of the research vessel allowed scientists to easily access the ocean for studies.

meanings.definition: The practice of basing a ship or fleet at a particular port for regular operations.
meanings.sent1: The homeporting of the cargo ships increased efficiency in transporting goods.
meanings.sent2: The navy's homeporting in Pearl Harbor was strategic during wartime.
meanings.sent3: The homeporting of the fishing boats in the bustling city seemed out of place.
meanings.sent4: The homeporting of the yachts at the exclusive marina added elegance to the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The homeporting of the cruise liners attracted tourists to the coastal town.
